statement.p: The Richter Scale reading of an earthquake is based on a logarithmic equation. Suppose:
\displaystyle{A} - the measure of the amplitude of the earthquake wave
\displaystyle{A}_{{0}} the amplitude of the smallest detectable wave (or standard wave).

An earthquake is measured with a wave amplitude \displaystyle{A}= 0.1619 while the smallest detectable wave \displaystyle{A}_{{0}} is measured at 0.0001 cm. What is the magnitude of this earthquake using the Richter scale, to the nearest tenth?
The earthquake registered on the Richter scale.
